title: Quantum Lattice
description: An interactive WebGL particle system featuring phase-driven dynamics, instanced rendering, and adaptive quality control. Explore quantum-inspired lattice formations with real-time parameter controls.
concept: This piece explores the intersection of quantum physics concepts and visual computing. Particles move through a dynamic phase field, creating emergent patterns that evoke quantum lattice structures. The system uses multi-harmonic wave functions to generate complex, evolving behaviors from simple mathematical rules.
technicalNotes: Built entirely with pure WebGL (no frameworks), featuring instanced rendering for efficient particle management, framebuffer-based trail effects, and adaptive quality control that maintains 60 FPS by dynamically adjusting particle count. The phase field uses bilinear interpolation for smooth gradient calculations.
inspiration: Inspired by quantum field theory, the visualization of wave functions, and the beauty of emergent complexity in physical systems.
